quest.name: Dragons in the Mist
journal: Gildon requires aid that he may embolden his comrades.

Gildon continues his quest to revitalize the spirit of Camp Cloudtop. To achieve this goal, he means to slay a dragon together with his men. This plan will fall through, however, if no dragons can be found in the area. Still waiting to be relieved from sentry duty, he asks that you gather information from the guards about Camp Cloudtop. Speak with the guards, then venture off in search of his prey.

You speak with the men standing guard about Camp Cloudtop. While none have seen leathery hide nor tail of dragons, one guard suspects they are being watched as they continue repairs of the Protector. Search the area for what may be monitoring the camp and prepare yourself for the worst.

While hunting for dragons, you find a Vanu atop a cliff with a clear view of Camp Cloudtop. The Vanu engages you, but is no match for your long-proven skill in combat. Report back to Gildon and tell him of your findings.
You tell Gildon of the Vanu, but he is disappointed rather than surprised. Uninterested in the threat of Vanu, he continues his search for a way to motivate his men.
objectives: Search the area for suspicious activity.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: If I cannot improve morale through food, then I will have to take more drastic measures. Yes, some heroic feat to rally the men and enliven their spirits. As they say, it is the idle man who is the miserable man.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: And for a man of Ishgard, what could be more heroic than slaying a dragon?

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: They say Camp Cloudtop is devoid of dragons, making it perfect for men of our lowly standing. But surely, at least one dragon has found its way to this region, no?

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: I cannot leave my post just yet, so I must ask that you take up the search until I am able.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: First, I suggest speaking with the men around camp for a lead. When you've tracked one down, report back to me. I shall gather the men and head out to slay the foul beast.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: Ask around to see what information you can ascertain. And remember: if you should encounter a dragon, leave it be and report here immediately.

dialogue.name: CARIBAULT
dialogue.text: Dragons? Here near Camp Cloudtop? I'm afraid you may be wasting your time. What business would dragons have here?

dialogue.name: CARIBAULT
dialogue.text: If it's dragons you want, you will not find them here. This sleepy little outpost has seen little action since its establishment.

dialogue.name: HARMIETTE
dialogue.text: You're looking for dragons? Hah! They wouldn't have assigned us here if they suspected such danger. We have the Vanu to contend with from time to time, but even we can handle the likes of them.

dialogue.name: HARMIETTE
dialogue.text: Hmmm, but now that I think about it... Recently we've been finding what look like the scraps of something feeding on the local wildlife. But surely it was not the work of a dragon...right?

dialogue.name: HARMIETTE
dialogue.text: Halone help us if dragons should come to Camp Cloudtop.

dialogue.name: JAUMINFREST
dialogue.text: When working to repair the Protector, I cannot help but feel that something is watching us. Whoever or whatever it is, I wonder why they would concern themselves with a broken airship.

dialogue.name: JAUMINFREST
dialogue.text: If someone is, in fact, watching our movements, could this mean the Dravanians have found an ally here in Cloudtop?

dialogue.name: VANUVANU01741
dialogue.text: Still no change. The field is calm likeâ”€hm!?

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Netherling will be cast into cloud sea!

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: How goes the search? Any word of dragons in Cloudtop?

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: No dragons, only Vanu? Well, I expected as much, to be sure, but I'm no less disappointed for it.

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: What could they be watching? There's naught here of interest save for the Protector, and even that is still in sore need of repairs. Do they perceive it to be a threat?

dialogue.name: GILDON
dialogue.text: At any rate, there is little glory won from a scuffle with Vanu. But mark my words: I will find a way to rekindle the fire in our men's hearts!
